teams.name: Entrefuse
teams.title: CTO
teams.summary: As co-founder and CTO, I am responsible primarily for managing the technical side of the company. In the early days I was the sole developer, eventually bringing in and managing contract developers and finally a full-time development team. I manage that team while continuing to contribute as a principle developer. As co-founder I also split product development, UX design and project management responsibilities with my co-founder.

projects.name: Codewars.com
projects.summary: Codewars.com enables developers to dramatically improve their coding skills through the use of small coding challenges called "kata". It has a user base of over 150k developers, who must first pass a series of simple programming tests before they can sign up.

highlights.text: Extended `Rails` to handle the concept known as PJAX on a more integrated and deeper level
Implemented a concept dubbed DJAX (Deferred AJAX) to allow `Rails` to handle slow-client requests by leveraging Web Sockets and Redis.
Wrote all of the front-end codebase myself.
Built a custom client-side templating engine complete with limited two-way bindings utilizing jQuery as the core framework
Built a custom client-side application framework built on top of jQuery that uses a hybrid design leveraging PJAX.
Architected the entire `Rails` API and MongoDB data model for the site.
Utilized advanced caching techniques by leveraging Redis and Memcached services together.
Managed a team of contracted developers that were brought in to enhance portions of the site.

projects.name: Strive.co
projects.summary: Strive.co is recruitement based product focused on placing skilled web developers into their dream positions.

highlights.text: Improved jbuilder performance by bypassing the need to use the `Rails` templating system.
Built a sophisticated and flexible `Rails` API scheme that allowed for multiple front-end clients to interface with it.
Implemented a micro-service oriented architecture leveraging Docker and Nginx to link Node.js and `Rails` services together.
Quickly learned AngularJS so that I could contribute to the codebase along with the rest of the front-end team.
Architected the entire Rails API and MongoDB data model for the site.
Utilized advanced caching techniques by leveraging Redis and Memcached services together.
Wrote Bash scripts to deploy Docker based architecture to AWS.
Managed AWS infrastructure.
Implemented a Neo4j database to map our database as a knowledge graph, which was used for analytics, reporting and recommendations

projects.name: Stateful
projects.summary: An easy to use but powerful state machine for Ruby. It was custom built instead of using other existing gems because none of the other solutions supported features that were needed.

highlights.text: Unique feature of the gem is the ability to create grouped states.
Gem provides an easy DSL for managing state changes and the events related to them.
Implementing this gem within the Codewars and Strive codebases significantly increased the ability to maintain a complex and constantly evolving codebase.

projects.name: Mongoidal
projects.summary: Mongoid on steroids - this gem contains a large number of add-on improvements to the Mongoid library.

projects.name: Batcan
projects.summary: Simple and expressive permissions system for Ruby on Rails projects

highlights.text: Created a much more natural and logic alternative to using the CanCan gem

teams.name: DirecTV
teams.title: Lead Web Developer
teams.summary: I was originally brought in for a year contract to work on the DirecTV website. The contract ended up being extended another 3 years, with me eventually taking a full-time position with their product development team to manaage their prototyping development.

projects.name: DirecTV.com
projects.summary: I lead the JavaScript development team for the .com team

highlights.text: Rebuilt the legacy codebase to use a more modern framework approach while still leveraging the underlying Prototype.JS library.
Was responsible for light weight integration of the Backend Web Development ATG/Java components with the Frontend Web Development codebase.

projects.name: DPEG
projects.summary: As a part of a team dedicated to exploring innovative forward thinking products, I created an internal tool for prototyping web apps.

highlights.text: Brainstormed with the team and played a role in making product decisions for future DirecTV web products
Prototyped future app ideas utilizing Ruby on Rails and jQuery

teams.name: Razorfish
teams.summary: Razorfish is a consulting firm that does both design and development work for popular brands such as the NFL and Audi. At the time the development staff in their LA office was almost fully commited to another project. I was brought in to help lead their development efforts on a smaller project.

projects.name: Parsons.com
projects.summary: The site was built on top of MS Sharepoint, since the organization already made so much use of the product internally.

Handled some backend C#/Sharepoint development when needed.
Integrated Google Maps deeply into the product, such as widgets and dynamic content

teams.name: Boom Music
teams.title: Software Developer
teams.summary: Boom was an early startup, basically Pandora for XBox/Playstation. It provided SDK's for game developers to integrate into their software. Curated playlists were used to match player's musical preferences with the context of the game - in order to enhance the gaming experience. The company eventually failed due to the inability to obtain series B funding.

projects.name: JSON API
projects.summary: I was a core contributor to the company's application API, which was used both by our website and by our SDKs

highlights.text: Refactored and Simplified C# business objects to allow for increased productivity

projects.name: Internal CMS
projects.summary: An internal tool which was used to ingest huge amounts of song data into our system, as well as used by the content team to manage playlists.

highlights.text: Rapidly built CMS front-end utilizing Ext JS
Designed a highly praised user experience for working with internal data
Developed an queue/digestion system for processing batches of over 100K+ MP3 files
Digestion system was able to scrub and reconcile data across multiple data sources

teams.name: Invoke Systems/Smith
teams.title: Software Developer
teams.summary: My first full-time development position. I originally interviewed for a web designer position but recent development work I had did with a Flash website motivated them to hire me as a developer. As they were a dev shop, I worked on numurious projects, many of which were for government and military. Eventually the company was acquired by Smith (formally Ascentium).

projects.name: Microsoft CRM
projects.summary: The last 3 years of my time with the company we had shifted our focus onto being a preferred MS CRM vendor. During this time I worked with a variety of clients including Seattle 411 and USDA. We became very good at bending the capabilities of the application to do things well beyond being a CRM.

highlights.text: Created an internal SDK that allowed our team to rapidly build-out advanced applications on top of the MS CRM platform
Worked with propsect clients to rapidly design and prototype custom CRM implementations that would work with their specific data model and needs.
Extended MS CRM well beyond its original use-case. Some use-cases include a 411 help desk, a casino "whale" tracker, real-time customer support and government management.

projects.name: Air Force Board of Corrections
projects.summary: I spent a year working on a custom windows app for the Air Force, which was used for document management by all of their departments. My primary responsibility was to implement the GUI for the app.

projects.name: Custom Web Development
projects.summary: My initial 4 years at the company was spent mostly building custom web applications for various clients such as the Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health and Hygiene.

highlights.text: On many projects I lead a small development team. I was responsible for reviewing code and delegating tasks.
Developed custom CMS and CRM applications for various clients using .NET technologies
Was the primary person at the company responsible for UX and UI design

projects.name: Reqeo
projects.summary: A startup idea based on recommendations for users based off of mutual followers and interests. I spent over a year working on the concept in my off-time. In the end, I created the product in too much of a vacuum. It was a hard lesson learned in the importance of keeping a product simple and getting it in front of actual users as soon as possible. It was also probably my masterpiece in terms of clean and maintanable C# code - another reason why the project failed as the time should have been spent elsewhere.

highlights.text: Built a custom client-side framework on top of jQuery to ease and DRY up development efforts. This framework was part of a similar design that I had been evolving over the passed 3 years.
Utilizing a non-standard open source ORM, I created a repository based data model that leveraged both SQL Server and MongoDB with a CQRS influenced architectual pattern.
